chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jose Rafael Torres

records.addlTxt:
2:44 PM Defendant Jose Rafael Torres appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kristina M Cervera Garcia in court for Jose Rafael Torres.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. Sworn as interpreter: LaRon Esau.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer M. Jimenez. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Sworn as interpreter:  Brenda Bartholomew.  Newly appointed defense counsel was given criminal complaint and signed order appointing her as counsel of record.  Defendant has not had a preliminary hearing.  Court ordered case adjourned for hearing.  mn

Defendant Jose Rafael Torres appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kristina M Cervera Garcia in court for Jose Rafael Torres.  Prosecuting attorney Jessica Bellows in court for the State of Wisconsin for Emily Zimmel.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Due to the State Public Defender failing to timely appoint counsel, the court appointed counsel at Milwaukee County expense.   Proposed order signed and filed.   mn

Defendant Jose Rafael Torres not in court, in custody.  Attorney Kristina M Cervera Garcia appeared by phone for Jose Rafael Torres.  Prosecuting attorney Kenneth Olstinski in court for the State of Wisconsin for ADA Emily Zimmel.  Case in court for State v. Lee hearing.  SPD has not appointed counsel.  Court finds CAUSE to appoint Attorney Kristina Cervera Garcia  who shall be paid at the rate of $100.00 per hour. Court  will hold open reimbursement at this time.  Case is adjourned in Br 45.  mn
The Court ordered warrant canceled as defendant is in the hospital under supervision.

Status conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jose Rafael Torres appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for the State of Wisconsin. Sworn as interpreter: Natalia Fajardo.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with A D R; N M T
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jose Rafael Torres appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jade K Hall appeared by video for Jose Rafael Torres.  Attorney Katrina Voge appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea

ADDRESS INFO for Jose Rafael Torres
Current: 2627 W Lapham Blvd, Milwaukee, WI 53204 United States  (Effective: 08-29-2022)
Prior: 740 East Linus Street #109, Milwaukee, WI 53207
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Jose Rafael Torres not in court.  Thomas L. Potter, along with student intern Joshua Kather under the student practice rule, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 08/19/2022@ 2:30p
